intro: Rhexia aspera, commonly known as roughleaf bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Rhexia aspera is a perennial herb that thrives in rich, well-drained soils.
